intro: Plagiobothrys humilis, commonly known as the lowly bluecurls, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Plagiobothrys humilis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands.
